Starting FlashFX on CE for the First Time

Send comments on this topic.
Once you have successfully built Windows CE with FlashFX Tera included, download the image to your target device.

Examine the debug output to ensure that the FlashFX Tera device driver is being loaded. You should see output similar to the following: 

        +-----------------------------------------------------+
        |                                                     |
        |  Datalight [PRODNAME] v4.0 Build 1850               |
        |  Copyright (c) 1993-2009 Datalight, Inc.            |
        |  Windows CE Edition for XScale                      |
        |  Patents: US#5860082, US#6260156.                   |
        |                                                     |
        +-----------------------------------------------------+

Once Windows CE has finished booting up, open "My Computer." You will see an icon labeled "FlashFX Disk." Right click on this icon and select "Properties." Ensure that the disk size is approximately what you chose.

Note -- Actual disk size will vary due to FlashFX Tera overhead, which involves a number of factors. Generally, the overhead will be 5-10% of the flash.

Storage Manager Utilities

In the Windows CE Control Panel, you will find a Storage Manager applet, which contains Format, Scandisk, and Defrag options. Format and Scandisk work with FlashFX Tera. Defrag will not function, and in any case, is not a useful function when using disks based on flash memory.
